Apple Creek, OH 44606

citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The program of veterinary care currently
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for distemper, parvovirus, and leptospirosis (DAPLP 7-way) annually.
Twenty-six adult dogs currently housed at the facility were not administered a vaccine containing leptospirosis as required
by the program of veterinary care. The dogs were administered a DAPP (5-way) vaccine on 5 July 2025. The last 7-way
vaccine that was administered to the adult dogs was on 4 July 2024 per available medical records.
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the program of veterinary care does not ensure the
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo,
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the program of veterinary care to protect the dogs from deadly or
contagious diseases.
Correct by 4 October 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The program of veterinary care currently 
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for distemper, parvovirus, and leptospirosis (DAPLP 7-way) annually.  
Twenty-six adult dogs currently housed at the facility were not administered a vaccine containing leptospirosis as required 
by the program of veterinary care. The dogs were administered a DAPP (5-way) vaccine on 5 July 2025. The last 7-way 
vaccine that was administered to the adult dogs was on 4 July 2024 per available medical records.  
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the program of veterinary care does not ensure the 
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo, 
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the program of veterinary care to protect the dogs from deadly or 
contagious diseases. 
Correct by 4 October 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n
